titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of AFL-CIO Serials WAG.362
titlestmt.author: Megan O'Shea
titlestmt.sponsor: The arrangement, description, and encoding of this collection has been made possible in part by a major grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities: Exploring the human endeavor.

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-06-27 17:54:47 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of AFL-CIO Serials

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

physdesc.extent: in 24 manuscript boxes and two flat boxes

did.abstract: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of AFL-CIO Serials contains over 100 titles published by and about the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations. The collection dates between 1887 and 2001, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1940s through the 1980s. Topics include labor related convention proceedings, council and president reports, and United States politics.
did.langmaterial: Materials primarily in English, with some publications in Spanish.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Serials in this collection are arranged alphabetically by title.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Because of the assembled nature of this collection, copyright status varies across the collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation. Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection combines serials relating to the AFL-CIO drawn from two discrete groups of material held by the Tamiment Library. The first was a partially inventoried backlog of serials, received by the library through donations, subscriptions, and in archival collections. The second group consisted of around 1,700 serials, newspapers, and magazines, organized by title as an artificial collection, referred to as Periodicals.001 or Boxed Newspapers. This material was combined, inventoried, and arranged and described in subject-based categories in 2017. The accession number related to this collection is 2017.049.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of AFL-CIO Serials; WAG 362; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The material in this collection was assembled from various backlogs of uncataloged material held by the Tamiment Library. This material was inventoried, separated according to its subject matter, and arranged in a series of subject-based artificial collections. Accumulations of material relating to AFL-CIO were identified and brought together physically. Materials were housed in archival folders and boxes according to size. The inventory is arranged alphabetically by title of publication, with publishing organization and place of publication listed when known.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of AFL-CIO Serials contains over 100 titles published by and about the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations (AFL-CIO). The collection dates between 1887 and 2001, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1940s through the 1980s. Topics include state and national AFL, CIO, and AFL-CIO annual and constitutional convention proceedings; council and president reports; and AFL-CIO reports on United States politics. The majority of the publications are conference proceedings from national CIO and AFL-CIO conventions, as well as Illinois State Federation of Labor and the Illinois State Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations. Other organizations represented include the New York State AFL-CIO, Iowa State Federation of Labor, the AFL-CIO Committee on Political Education (COPE), and the AFL-CIO's Industrial Union Department.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to the fragile nature of certain original materials, researchers may be required to consult microfilm copies, preservation photocopies, or digital images of material in this collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For more serials on labor organizations and labor-related topics, see the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Labor Movement Serials, WAG.345.
